title: Hochscheid
text:
Hochscheid is an "Ortsgemeinde" – a <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Germany">municipality</a> belonging to a "<a href="Verbandsgemeinde">Verbandsgemeinde</a>", a kind of collective municipality – in the <a href="Bernkastel-Wittlich">Bernkastel-Wittlich</a> <a href="Districts%20of%20Germany">district</a> in <a href="Rhineland-Palatinate">Rhineland-Palatinate</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>.
Geography.
Location.
This rural municipality lies in the middle of low-mountain country in the <a href="Hunsr%C3%BCck">Hunsrück</a>, at the foot of the Idarkopf. Hochscheid belongs to the <a href="Bernkastel-Kues%20%28Verbandsgemeinde%29">"Verbandsgemeinde" of Bernkastel-Kues</a>, whose seat is in the <a href="Bernkastel-Kues">like-named town</a>.
Neighbouring municipalities.
Neighbouring municipalities within a five-kilometre radius are <a href="Horbruch">Horbruch</a> (1.19 km away <a href="as%20the%20crow%20flies">as the crow flies</a>), <a href="Wahlenau">Wahlenau</a> (3.02 km), <a href="Hirschfeld%2C%20Rhineland-Palatinate">Hirschfeld</a> (3.02 km), <a href="Kleinich">Kleinich</a> (3.03 km) and <a href="Krummenau">Krummenau</a> (3.58 km). The nearest <a href="Central%20place%20theory">middle centre</a> is <a href="Bernkastel-Kues">Bernkastel-Kues</a>.
History.
Antiquity.
The most important sanctuary to the <a href="Gauls">Gallic</a> divinity <a href="Sirona">Sirona</a> stands in Hochscheid, where a <a href="Latin">Latin</a> inscription “DEO APOLLINI ET SANCTE SIRONE” (Eng. "To the god <a href="Apollo">Apollo</a> and holy Sirona") can also be found, in which the <a href="Ancient%20Rome">Roman</a> Apollo likely has been identified with the <a href="Celts">Celtic</a> god <a href="Grannus">Grannus</a> through the "<a href="Interpretatio%20Romana">Interpretatio Romana</a>". Since Apollo and <a href="Diana%20%28mythology%29">Diana</a> were held to be siblings, this kinship is here transferred to Sirona and Apollo Grannus.
Medieval/Early Modern.
Hochscheid belonged to the “Hinder” <a href="County%20of%20Sponheim">County of Sponheim</a>. The first known chapel was already standing here by 1529. It was probably consecrated to <a href="Saint%20Giles">Saint Giles</a>. By 1743 this chapel had been destroyed, possibly in the <a href="Thirty%20Years%27%20War">Thirty Years' War</a>. In 1752 the chapel was built anew, but by 1790, only the tower was still standing. Later, a “winter school” ("Winterschule" – a kind of agricultural school that grew up in response to the <a href="Industrial%20Revolution">Industrial Revolution</a>) was built onto the tower. Hanging in the chapel was a bell from 1629 with the inscription "“Johann Burchart Trarbach Pfarher zu Clenich. Johann Schüßler Kirchenmeister. Anno MDCXXIX”" (“Johann Burchart Trarbach clergyman at Cleinich. Johann Schüßler church father. In the year 1629”).
Politics.
Municipal council.
The council is made up of 6 council members, who were elected by <a href="Plurality%20voting%20system">majority vote</a> at the municipal election held on 7 June 2009, and the honorary mayor as chairman.
Coat of arms.
The municipality’s <a href="Coat%20of%20arms">arms</a> might be described thus: Vert in base water argent with ripples of the field, dexter a lyre of the second, leaning against which a laurel twig bendwise slipped in base Or.
The arms are derived from a <a href="Ancient%20Rome">Roman</a> <a href="spring%20%28hydrosphere%29">spring</a> sanctum from the 2nd century unearthed high in the woods. It shows the spring god <a href="Apollo">Apollo</a>’s attributes, the lyre and the laurel, as well as springwater.
Economy and infrastructure.
Public transport in Hochscheid is integrated into the "Verkehrsverbund Region Trier" (VRT), whose fares therefore apply.
